<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Bugs of reloading model when best_k_models.json not exist <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mpariente/asteroid/blob/0bdec2644f2d770d037ce804b7f70cb98bd5c9fa/egs/wsj0-mix/DeepClustering/model.py#L156-L157>https://github.com/mpariente/asteroid/blob/0bdec2644f2d770d037ce804b7f70cb98bd5c9fa/egs/wsj0-mix/DeepClustering/model.py#L156-L157</denchmark-link>
The lines use sort to get the last model, which will performs in a incorrect way in the following situation <denchmark-code>>>> all_ckpt=['ckpt_epoch_99.ckpt','ckpt_epoch_100.ckpt','ckpt_epoch_101.ckpt'] >>> all_ckpt.sort() >>> all_ckpt[-1] 'ckpt_epoch_99.ckpt' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Maybe we can use the following methods: <denchmark-code>>>> all_ckpt=[(ckpt,int("".join(filter(str.isdigit,os.path.basename(ckpt))))) for ckpt in all_ckpt if ckpt.find('ckpt')>=0] >>> all_ckpt.sort(key=lambda x:x[1]) >>> all_ckpt[-1][0] 'ckpt_epoch_101.ckpt' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Python 3.7
